metadata.title: Block or Unblock IP addresses - ForcepointNGFW
metadata.description: This playbook checks if malicious IP address is blocked or unblocked by SMC firewall.
mainSteps: 1. Fetches a list of potentially malicious IP addresses
2. Sends the list of all malicious IP address to SOC via adaptive card.
3. Soc can block or ignore unblocked IP address as well as unblock or ignore blocked IP address.
prerequisites: 1. Forcepoint SMC Custom Connector needs to be deployed prior to the deployment of this playbook under the same resource group.
2. Forcepoint SMC API Key should be known.[Refer here](http://www.websense.com/content/support/library/ngfw/v610/rfrnce/ngfw_6100_ug_smc-api_a_en-us.pdf )
3. Forcepoint SMC Version number should be known. [Refer here](https://help.stonesoft.com/onlinehelp/StoneGate/SMC/)
4. Security policy rule name created in SMC should be known.
5. Users must have access to Microsoft Teams and they should be a part of a Teams channel and also Power Automate app should be installed in the Microsoft Teams channel.

Enter the api key for smc login

Enter smc firewall security policy rule

body.message:
@{outputs('Forcepoint_Logo')}Forcepoint NGFW Block or Unblock IP Address by SOC.
The below IP address are found to be malicious and playbook taken action against to that IPs.

@{body('Create_HTML_table_for_Add_comment_to_incident')}
